description: Verify that the Password Recovery page loads correctly when accessing the /password/forgot URL
scenario: User navigates to the forgot password page to recover their account access
expected_results: Display the complete password recovery page with cybersecurity-themed design and email input form
procedure:
1. Open web browser
2. Navigate to http://localhost:5000/password/forgot
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check page title displays 'Forgot Password'
5. Verify password recovery form is visible and properly styled
6. Check cybersecurity-themed design elements are present

description: Verify the password recovery header displays correctly with orange-red gradient theme
scenario: User views the password recovery header with security-focused styling
expected_results: Display 'Password Recovery' title with key icon and orange-red gradient design
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Verify gradient background from blue to purple (from-blue-50 via-indigo-100 to-purple-100)
3. Check key icon (bi-key) is displayed in orange-red gradient circle
4. Verify 'Password Recovery' title with gradient text effect
5. Check subtitle 'Enter your email to reset your password'
6. Verify animated background elements are present
7. Test dark mode compatibility with gradient adjustments

description: Verify email input field displays correctly with proper validation and styling
scenario: User enters email address to request password recovery
expected_results: Display properly styled email field with envelope icon, validation, and user guidance
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Verify 'Email Address' field with envelope-at icon (bi-envelope-at)
3. Check blue color scheme for email field (text-blue-600 dark:text-blue-400)
4. Test focus effects (focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500)
5. Verify placeholder text 'Enter your email address'
6. Check help text 'We'll send you a secure link to reset your password'
7. Test field styling in dark mode
8. Verify HTML5 email input type validation

description: Verify hCaptcha displays and functions correctly for security verification
scenario: User completes hCaptcha verification before submitting password recovery request
expected_results: Display hCaptcha widget with security verification label when hCaptcha is enabled
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page with hCaptcha enabled
2. Verify 'Security Verification' label with robot icon (bi-robot)
3. Check hCaptcha widget is displayed and centered
4. Test hCaptcha functionality by completing verification
5. Verify hCaptcha integration with form submission
6. Test page behavior when hCaptcha is disabled
7. Check hCaptcha styling consistency with page theme

description: Verify send reset link button displays correctly with loading states
scenario: User submits password recovery request and observes button behavior
expected_results: Display dynamic button with proper styling for normal and loading states
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Verify normal state shows 'Send Reset Link' with envelope icon
3. Check orange-red gradient styling (from-orange-500 to-red-600)
4. Test hover effects (hover:from-orange-600 hover:to-red-700, hover:scale-105)
5. Verify focus ring styling (focus:ring-4 focus:ring-orange-500/25)
6. Test loading state animation (spinner and 'Sending...' text)
7. Check button accessibility and keyboard interaction
8. Verify button styling in dark mode

description: Verify back to login link displays and functions correctly
scenario: User decides to return to login page instead of resetting password
expected_results: Display 'Back to Login' link that navigates to login page with proper styling
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Scroll to bottom of form
3. Verify 'Remember your password?' text is displayed
4. Check 'Back to Login' link with blue styling and arrow icon
5. Click link and verify navigation to login page
6. Test link hover effects and accessibility
7. Verify link styling in dark mode

description: Verify successful password recovery request with valid email address
scenario: User submits valid email address and receives password recovery email
expected_results: Display success message and send password reset email to valid email address
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Enter valid registered email address
3. Complete hCaptcha if enabled
4. Click 'Send Reset Link' button
5. Verify success message 'If an account with that email exists, we've sent password reset instructions.'
6. Check email is sent to user's email address
7. Verify password reset token is created in database
8. Check email contains proper reset link and styling
9. Verify redirect to login page after submission

description: Verify security handling for non-existent email addresses
scenario: User enters email address that doesn't exist in the system
expected_results: Display same success message without revealing email existence for security
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Enter non-existent email address
3. Complete hCaptcha if enabled
4. Click 'Send Reset Link' button
5. Verify same success message is displayed
6. Check no email is actually sent
7. Verify no sensitive information is leaked
8. Check no database errors occur
9. Confirm user cannot determine if email exists

description: Verify email format validation and error handling
scenario: User enters invalid email formats and receives appropriate validation
expected_results: Proper email validation with format checking and error messages
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Leave email field empty and submit form
3. Verify error message 'Please provide your email address.'
4. Enter invalid email format (missing @) and test
5. Enter email with invalid domain format
6. Test various malformed email addresses
7. Verify HTML5 email validation works
8. Check server-side validation matches client-side

description: Verify hCaptcha validation prevents automated attacks
scenario: User attempts to submit form without completing hCaptcha verification
expected_results: Form submission blocked until hCaptcha is completed successfully
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page with hCaptcha enabled
2. Enter valid email address
3. Submit form without completing hCaptcha
4. Verify error message 'Please complete the captcha verification.'
5. Complete hCaptcha verification
6. Submit form and verify successful processing
7. Test hCaptcha timeout and re-verification
8. Check hCaptcha integration prevents bot attacks

description: Verify proper handling when database is disabled (Vercel environment)
scenario: User attempts password recovery in deployment environment with disabled database
expected_results: Display warning message about password reset unavailability
procedure:
1. Set DISABLE_DATABASE config to True
2. Navigate to /password/forgot page
3. Enter email address and submit form
4. Verify warning message 'Password reset is not available in this deployment environment.'
5. Check form remains accessible but reset is blocked
6. Verify no database operations are attempted
7. Test user experience with clear messaging

description: Verify redirect behavior when user is already authenticated
scenario: Logged-in user tries to access password recovery page
expected_results: Automatic redirect to home page for authenticated users
procedure:
1. Login with existing account
2. Navigate to /password/forgot page while logged in
3. Verify automatic redirect to home page
4. Check redirect preserves any query parameters
5. Test redirect security (no open redirects)
6. Verify user experience is seamless
7. Check no password recovery form is displayed to logged-in users

description: Verify password reset email contains proper template, styling, and content
scenario: User receives password reset email with professional design and security information
expected_results: Email displays with cybersecurity theme, reset link, and security notices
procedure:
1. Submit valid password recovery request
2. Check email is received in user's inbox
3. Verify email subject 'Password Reset Request - Phalanx Cyber Academy'
4. Check HTML email template with gradient header
5. Verify reset URL is properly formatted and secure
6. Check security notice about 1-hour expiration
7. Test both HTML and plain text versions
8. Verify email styling works across email clients

description: Verify password reset token generation and security properties
scenario: System generates secure password reset token for valid requests
expected_results: Generate cryptographically secure token with proper expiration
procedure:
1. Submit password recovery request
2. Verify PasswordResetToken is created in database
3. Check token is cryptographically random and secure
4. Verify token expiration is set (1 hour)
5. Check token is associated with correct user
6. Test token uniqueness across multiple requests
7. Verify old tokens are invalidated when new ones are created
8. Check token cleanup for expired entries

description: Verify proper error handling when email service fails
scenario: Email service is unavailable or misconfigured during password recovery
expected_results: Graceful error handling without exposing system details to user
procedure:
1. Configure invalid email server settings
2. Submit password recovery request
3. Verify user still sees success message for security
4. Check error is logged properly for debugging
5. Test with missing MAIL_SERVER configuration
6. Verify no sensitive information is exposed
7. Check system continues to function despite email failure
8. Test email service recovery scenarios

description: Verify password recovery handling for different account statuses
scenario: Users with different account statuses request password recovery
expected_results: Only active accounts receive password reset emails
procedure:
1. Test password recovery with active account (should work)
2. Test with inactive account (should not send email)
3. Test with suspended account status
4. Verify same success message for all cases
5. Check only active accounts receive reset emails
6. Test account status verification logic
7. Verify security implications of account status
8. Check proper logging for different account states

description: Verify CSRF token integration and protection
scenario: User submits password recovery form with CSRF protection enabled
expected_results: CSRF token is properly included and validated with form submission
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. View page source and verify csrf_token hidden field
3. Submit form with valid email
4. Verify CSRF token is included in POST request
5. Test form submission without CSRF token (should fail)
6. Check CSRF token validation in Flask-WTF
7. Verify security against CSRF attacks
8. Test CSRF token refresh on page reload

description: Verify password recovery form elements animate correctly
scenario: User observes form appearance animations on page load
expected_results: Form elements appear in staggered sequence with fade-in-up animations
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page (clear cache first)
2. Observe form animation sequence on page load
3. Verify form container animates first (opacity-0 animate-fade-in-up)
4. Check email field animates with 0.3s delay
5. Verify hCaptcha section animates with 0.4s delay
6. Check button animates with 0.5s delay
7. Verify back to login link animates with 0.6s delay
8. Test animation performance and smoothness

description: Verify password recovery page displays correctly in dark mode

3. Verify background gradient changes to dark theme
4. Check form background uses dark theme (dark:bg-gray-800/90)
5. Verify text colors invert properly (dark:text-white)
6. Test input field styling in dark mode
7. Check button gradients and hover effects
8. Verify hCaptcha integration works in dark theme
9. Test accessibility and contrast ratios

description: Verify password recovery page is responsive across different screen sizes

description: Verify password recovery page has proper SEO elements and security headers
scenario: Search engines and security scanners analyze password recovery page
expected_results: Page has proper title, security headers, and prevents indexing

3. Verify noindex meta tag (password pages should not be indexed)
4. Check for proper heading hierarchy
5. Verify security headers prevent framing/embedding
6. Test robots.txt handling for password pages
7. Check canonical URL if applicable
8. Verify no sensitive information in meta tags

description: Verify password recovery page meets accessibility standards (WCAG)
scenario: User with disabilities accesses password recovery form using assistive technologies
expected_results: Form is fully accessible with proper labels, ARIA attributes, and keyboard navigation
procedure:
1. Navigate to /password/forgot page
2. Test keyboard navigation through all form elements
3. Verify tab order is logical (email → hCaptcha → button)
4. Check all form fields have proper labels
5. Test form with screen reader software
6. Verify focus indicators are visible and clear
7. Check color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards
8. Test error messages are announced by screen readers
9. Verify form validation errors are accessible
10. Check ARIA landmarks and roles are properly used

description: Verify password recovery page loads efficiently with optimal performance
scenario: User accesses password recovery page and expects fast loading times
expected_results: Page loads within acceptable time limits with all styling and functionality
procedure:
1. Clear browser cache
2. Open browser developer tools Performance tab
3. Navigate to /password/forgot page
4. Record page load time and performance metrics
5. Verify total load time is under 2 seconds
6. Check First Contentful Paint (FCP) is under 1 second
7. Verify Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) is acceptable
8. Test page load on slower network connections
9. Check for render-blocking resources
10. Verify animations don't impact performance significantly
